security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill that makes documented HTTP API calls to generate images. It reads a user-provided API key from a config file and makes calls to apicore.ai. No code execution, no obfuscation, no credential exfiltration patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Third-party API dependency
low_findings.description: Skill makes HTTP calls to api.apicore.ai using user-provided API keys. Users should be aware this connects to an external service. Code from SKILL.md lines 28-36: 'curl -s -X POST "https://api.apicore.ai/v1/images/generations" -H "Authorization: Bearer API_KEY"'

content.value_statement: Creating images from scratch takes time and skill. This skill lets you generate images using natural language prompts with Gemini AI. Simply describe what you want and get professional results in seconds.
actual_capabilities: Generate images from text descriptions using Gemini AI models
Create variations of existing images using image-to-image mode
Support for multiple aspect ratios (1:1, 16:9, 9:16, and more)
Choose from different model quality levels (standard, 2K, 4K)
Process Chinese text prompts for image generation
Modify text in existing images with guided instructions
limitations: Requires a separate API key registration from ismaque.org
Image generation credits depend on your API plan
Quality may vary based on prompt clarity and model selection
Complex image modifications require multiple attempts

use_cases.title: Create social media visuals
use_cases.description: Generate featured images, thumbnails, and banners for content without design tools

use_cases.title: Prototype UI visuals
use_cases.description: Quickly create mockups and visual concepts for app interfaces and wireframes

use_cases.title: Illustrate stories
use_cases.description: Generate scene illustrations and character visuals to accompany written content

output_examples.input: Generate a cyberpunk city at night with neon lights
output: âœ“ Image generated successfully using gemini-3-pro-image-preview model
âœ“ Your image is ready at: [generated_image_url]

best_practices: Use clear, specific descriptions with visual details like colors, lighting, and composition
Start with the basic model before trying higher resolutions for complex prompts
Save successful prompt patterns for reuse across similar image generation tasks
anti_patterns: Using overly vague prompts like 'make it look good' without specific direction
Trying to generate complex scenes in a single attempt instead of building up details
Ignoring aspect ratio settings for specific use cases like banners or social posts

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use it whenever you need to generate images through conversation.

faq.question: How do I get an API key?
faq.answer: Register at ismaque.org to get your API key. Copy secrets.example.md to secrets.md and add your key there.

faq.question: Is my API key data safe?
faq.answer: Your API key is stored locally in secrets.md. The skill only sends it to api.apicore.ai for image generation requests.

faq.question: Why did my image generation fail?
faq.answer: Common causes include invalid API key, insufficient credits, network issues, or prompts that violate content policies.

faq.question: How is this different from DALL-E or Midjourney?
faq.answer: This skill uses the Gemini API through apicore.ai. It offers a conversational interface through Claude Code with text and image-to-image modes.
